comments.author: Tanya
comments.content: That looks so yum! And it's so easy to make too.

comments.author: A&N
comments.content:
I just love the idea of dropping by next door and picking up stuff to cook for dinner! Reminds me of home :)

Among the pastas, I love fettucine and spaghetti the most. One of my goals this year is to 'make' pasta. I'm not sure I will be able to make either type of pasta, but if I do make any pasta, I think I will use this sauce!

Lovely!

comments.author: Cookie
comments.content: I kinda have the same idea where I look at the weekly ad to see what's on sale at the local grocery store and then plan my meals around it.  It makes planning dinners fun and exciting!

comments.author: renee
comments.content:
Looks tasty! I might have to try with some GF pasta.
I might have to buy some vermouth to keep around since I just don't drink wine often. Is it a good sub in most recipes or just this one in particular?

comments.author: Sara
comments.content: Let me know if you make this again, or any variation, and need tasters!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hi Renee - I think vermouth works well in many recipes that call for white wine. The flavor is a little different but I think it is pretty compatible in most cases.

comments.author: pb
comments.content:
Great recipe, Mike..

Yaay for farmers markets! but i think that the west coast is blessed with better ones.. this looks quite fresh, and i like the part about diners wandering in with wild looks..lol.. i could actually picturize it!

comments.author: Josh!
comments.content: Made this for dinner last night and it got rave reviews from my guests. Great recipe.

comments.author: Carolyn Jung
comments.content: That's so true about fresh pasta. You don't have to weigh it down with a heavy sauce. The lightest ones sometimes are the best and do it the most justice.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks Josh! I'm glad it was a hit.

comments.author: Hope
comments.content: That looks delicious! Do you live in the CD?

comments.author: Veggie
comments.content: This looks absolutely delicious! Is there a substitute for white wine? I prefer to avoid alcohol in our food.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Verjus is a good non-alcoholic substitute for wine. Probably use about 1/4 as much verjus as you would wine. Here's a link for it: http://amzn.to/djokFv . It is also good in salad dressings.

comments.author: Veggie
comments.content: Thank you! I will look for it in Whole foods too.

comments.author: axel g
comments.content:
It looks just delicious!

I love a touch of chili with fresh pasta.

Nice recipe +_+

comments.author: Jackie
comments.content: Made this last night and there were no left overs!  Next time I think I would add more broccoli raab and finish with a touch of lemon zest.  I used a dry white wine, because after researching how to store vermouth, I realized my vermouth has been sitting in the wine rack, unrefrigerated, for the past month or so.  Note to self:  buy new bottle of vermouth, store in fridge after opening.  Thanks for your wonderful recipe...my sons are quite the food critics and they could not get enough of this pasta dish!
